messages.title: A 'Living Wage' for all
messages.content: We think it's unfair that irresponsible bankers who are pushing share prices go on earning huge salaries while 4 million UK children live in poverty. We think it's unfair that the Government have failed to do anything about the growing gap between rich and poor.

messages.title: A million new jobs
messages.content: We think it's unfair that so many people are unemployed when there's vital work that needs doing. Bringing Britain's housing up to 'green' standards would create much-needed jobs for builders, plumbers, electricians and engineers.

messages.title: A 'Living Wage' gap
messages.content: We think it's unfair that NHS hospitals and health centres are treated like businesses rather than vital public services. We want to make sure no more public money is wasted on badly implemented privatisation schemes.

messages.title: Protect our NHS
messages.content: We think it's unfair that hospitals and health centres are treated like businesses rather than vital public services. We want to make sure no more public money is wasted on badly implemented privatisation schemes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Green MPs will demand a 'Living Wage' to ensure low paid workers earn enough to provide for themselves and their families. We will fight for a fair deal, with community banks, credit unions and mutuals providing realistic loans to families and small businesses.

Green MPs will push for a free insulation scheme for every single home as part of a green package to cut fuel bills and create a milllion new jobs. Green Party councillors have already pioneered such a scheme in Kirklees.
Green MPs will fight to ensure all services are easy to use and local supplies truly local. We will oppose cuts, closures and privatisation and will protect the jobs of public sector workers.

issues.environment: Bringing Britain's housing up to 'green' standards would create much-needed jobs for builders, plumbers, electricians and engineers.
issues.health: We think it's unfair that hospitals and health centres are treated like businesses rather than vital public services. We want to make sure no more public money is wasted on badly implemented privatisation schemes.

housing.content: Bringing Britain's housing up to 'green' standards would create much-needed jobs for builders, plumbers, electricians and engineers.

quotes.text: Greens are ahead! Our 'green' policies on climate change, renewable energy and recycling were established well before they were claimed by the big parties. Now that the European Parliament, the Scottish Parliament, the London Assembly and many local councils...
